title: Technology-Enhanced Creative Mathematics Learning Design: Applying Vygotsky’s Theory

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and basic smartphone operation skills
context.additional_context: For learners preparing for elementary education careers, experiencing mathematics learning designs combining Vygotsky’s theory and creativity in a smartphone-enhanced skill-building environment.

learning_goals: Learners can creatively design mathematics problem-solving strategies through collaboration with peers/instructors by utilizing Vygotsky's Zone of Proximal Development (ZPD) concept
Learners can present three or more creative methods to express visual and numerical thinking processes using smartphone-based digital tools (e.g., educational apps, collaborative platforms).
Learners can demonstrate educational creativity by understanding the evolving role of teachers in technology-enhanced environments and designing personalized feedback systems.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
